item.title: About us
item.description: We are three David Beauchesne (co-founder) I am one of the founders of inSileco and a postdoctoral researcher at Universit√© Laval. I am an ecologist working on ecosystem-based management in general and cumulative effects assessments in particular, with a focus on open science, reproducibility and computational tools. Kevin Cazelles (co-founder) Co-fonder of inSileco, associate researcher at the University of Guelph, open and reproducible research advocate. For almost ten years now, I have been tackling research challenges in various areas of ecology.

item.title: Education
item.description: This is what we have done so far. Interactive Raster Visualization with R Bedford Institute of Oceanography, Fisheries and Oceans Canada [https://github.com/inSilecoInc/workshop_raster https://github.com/inSilecoInc/interactiveRaster] Reproducible Workflows. Increase Everyday Efficiency Bedford Institute of Oceanography, Fisheries and Oceans Canada https://insilecoinc.github.io/workshop_reproducibility/ Working and visualizing spatial data with R Canadian Wildlife Service, Environment and Climate Change Canada https://insilecoinc.github.io/wksh_raster_CWS/ Work more collaboratively in R with git and GitHub Bedford Institute of Oceanography, Fisheries and Oceans Canada https://github.

item.title: Projects
item.description: The projects that we have been involved with as scientists, as members of inSileco, or both.
